title: The Conditional Cycle
story: While loops are different from for loops - they keep running as long as a condition is true. They're perfect when you don't know exactly how many times to repeat, but you know when to stop!
instructions: Create a variable `count` starting at 1. Use a while loop that runs while count <= 5. Inside the loop, print count, then increment it by 1. The loop should print numbers 1 through 5.

tests.expectedBehavior: After loop completes, count should be 6

hints.text: While loop syntax: while condition: followed by indented code. Don't forget to update the variable!
Start count at 1. Loop while count <= 5. Inside: print count, then count += 1
count = 1, while count <= 5: print(count) then count += 1 (both indented)
